questions.question: What is a 'Logic Error'?

options.text: When you misspell a word in your code
When the program crashes with an exception
When the program runs but produces an incorrect result
When you lose your internet connection

questions.explanation: Logic errors occur when your thinking is flawed, even though the syntax is correct.

questions.question: What does 'Rubber Duck Debugging' involve?

options.text: Explaining your code line-by-line to someone (or something)
Writing code while floating in a pool

questions.explanation: Explaining code out loud helps the brain catch discrepancies between expectation and reality.

questions.question: Which module provides built-in debugging capabilities in Python?
questions.explanation: pdb is the built-in Python DeBugger.

questions.question: Should you leave your 'print' statements in the final version of your software?

options.text: Yes, to help users debug it
No, they should be removed or replaced with logging

questions.explanation: Debug prints can leak information and clutter the output for users. Always clean up after debugging.
